thread.title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte dismisses fixture dig by Man United's Jose Mourinho as jealousy
thread.title_full: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte dismisses fixture dig by Man United's Jose Mourinho as jealousy

author: Neil McLeman
title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte dismisses fixture dig by Man United's Jose Mourinho as jealousy

organizations.name: cancel play now antonio conte previews spurs

text:
Sport Chelsea boss Antonio Conte dismisses fixture dig by Man United's Jose Mourinho as jealousy "I think they are angry for our position, not for the fixture" says Italian, whose men get over 48 hours more rest after their weekend game than the Red Devils did Share Conte isn't surprised to hear Mourinho (right) suggest his leaders have an unfair advantage Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Antonio Conte has hit back at Jose Mourinho by claiming Chelsea 's title rivals are only whinging about their fixture schedule because they are top of the table. 
The Premier League leaders will set a new top-flight record of 14 consecutive wins in one season — and open up an eight-point gap to second-placed Liverpool — if they beat Tottenham on Wednesday night. 
Former Blues boss Mourinho, now at Manchester United, claimed Spurs and Chelsea had the “privilege” of playing on Wednesday — getting extra rest during the hectic holiday period. 
United, in contrast, played on New Year's Eve and then again just 48 hours later, on Monday evening. 
But Conte claimed his side are now a target because they are hot title favourites. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Antonio Conte previews Spurs v Chelsea Share this video Watch Next 
“I can reply that I didn’t do the fixtures,” said the former Juventus boss. “The advantage is one more day of rest over Tottenham [Chelsea beat Stoke on Saturday, Spurs won at Watford on Sunday]. 
“During a season, different situations can happen when you can have advantage - but for sure not this. 
“I think they are angry for our position, not for the fixture. 
"I think it’s normal. This also happens in Italy. It’s always because you stay at the top of the table.” 
Conte lavished praise on Spurs opposite number Mauricio Pochettino and claimed the Argentinean “can be one of the best coaches in the world”. Cahill and co will have had double the rest Man United got after also playing on Saturday (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Conte reveals exactly what Costa told him when he decided to stay at Chelsea 
He added: “I think they [Tottenham] are better and stronger than last season. Also, this season, there is a very important player for him, who is Victor Wanyama [signed in the summer from Southampton]. He is a really good player.” 
Chelsea equalled Arsenal’s 2001-02 mark of 13 wins in a season by beating Stoke at the weekend. And victory at White Hart Lane will see them open up a 13-point gap over Spurs – and surely end their title hopes again, after the Battle of the Bridge did the same thing in May. 
But Conte, who won eight Serie A titles with Juve as a player and then their coach, insisted: “You don’t win and you don’t lose a championship in one game. You win a championship over a season.” Serial winner Conte was part of EIGHT Serie A titles with Juventus as player and coach (Photo: Getty) Read More 
The Italian is so obsessed with winning he named his daughter Vittoria – the Italian word for victory. 
He joked: “This name is nice. 
"It’s an important name, above all in England! My wife is Elizabeth, so I have two Queens – Elizabeth and Vittoria! Very English, because I knew one day I would arrive here in England to work! 
“I like this name and I wanted this name for my daughter. I like the name, then I like a lot the word vittoria — both!” poll loading Will Chelsea beat Tottenham to make it 14 wins in a row? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
